item.title: Aqara announces Apple-friendly doorbell, outdoor camera, video hub, and more

review.headline_rewrite: Aqara announces Apple-friendly doorbell, outdoor camera, video hub, and more
bullets: Aqara’s at IFA in Berlin where it just announced a slew of new smart home products, highlighted by a new wired doorbell camera, a video recording hub for Aqara cameras, and the company’s first battery-powered camera for outdoor use.
The new Doorbell Camera G400 is only available for wired installations, and works with Apple’s HomeKit Secure Video for secure cloud-based recordings and facial recognition.
The Home Station M410 is a multi-functional security hub that creates a central point of access for Aqara’s cameras, while also helping to extend their operating range.

item.title: Anker stuffed its awesome Nebula X1 projector into a party speaker

review.headline_rewrite: Anker stuffed its awesome Nebula X1 projector into a party speaker
bullets: A pair of 80W soundbar speakers fold out on the left and right sides and can be detached to optimize placement at the front of the room, with a pair of 40W wireless satellites for the rear channels, as well.
You can also put the X1 Pro into Bluetooth speaker mode when music is the only entertainment required.
Only now, everything is rated at IP43 to help protect it from light rain and dust.
It’ll hit retail channels around March 2026.

item.title: The best live TV streaming services to cut cable in 2025

review.headline_rewrite: The best live TV streaming services to cut cable in 2025
bullets: Read more about how we evaluate products.

expiration | Multiview: Yes (select programming) | Contract: No | Free trial: Yes (length varies)
In mid-December of 2024, subscribers got a bummer of an email letting them know the price of YouTube TV would be going up yet again, this time to $83, which is a $10 hike from the last increase of $8 in March of 2023.

Even if you fight the urge to roll Max, Shudder and AcornTV into the mix at signup, the enticement remains as it’s dangerously easy to add more to your subscription — when I searched for a program on a network I didn’t have, I was prompted to add it.
Still, it’s nice to have all your entertainment in one place.
You get unlimited cloud DVR space (though recordings expire after nine months) and it’s dead simple to add programming to your library.
The feature was available for NCAA basketball and in-season major American leagues (hockey, soccer and basketball at the time of testing).

item.title: Eufy's MarsWalker allows its robot vacuums to climb stairs

review.headline_rewrite: Eufy's MarsWalker allows its robot vacuums to climb stairs
bullets: This little doodad picks up robot vacuums and carries them up and down stairs.
That's pretty neat, considering stairs are the bane of any robovac's existence.
The company says the MarsWalker automatically recognizes common stair types, including straight, L-shaped and U-shaped.

Eufy boasts that the device allows for "truly hands-free, whole-home cleaning while avoiding the cost of buying multiple devices."
It uses four control arms that "dynamically adapt to stair structures," along with a track-drive system that "grips each step securely." The company notes that it has been designed to prevent slips.
Still, it's cool to see robot vacuums finally adapting to stairs.
The Omni S2 includes an aromatherapy system, which is fairly novel, and adaptive wheels to clear thresholds like thick rugs.

item.title: Judge Rules Trump Administration Illegally Canceled Harvard Funding

review.headline_rewrite: Judge Rules Trump Administration Illegally Canceled Harvard Funding

bullets:
Grammarly launches new AI agents to assist students and professionals with writing tasks
Grammarly has introduced eight new AI agents within its AI writing surface, 'docs,' designed to aid students and professionals with diverse writing tasks.
These agents offer functionalities like citation finding, plagiarism checking, and AI detection, alongside features predicting reader reactions and providing rubric-based feedback.
This launch signifies Grammarly's move towards agent-based AI to enhance writing across various platforms.
